stems.BSC: spatial position of an entity; to be situated/located at
stems.CTE: The act of physically occupying a/the position/location in space; to physically occupy a/the position in space
stems.CSV: A/the position/location in space occupied by an entity; to be a/the position/location in space
stems.OBJ: The entity situated/located at; to be that which situated/located at

stems: Direction relative to the observer [i.e., linear directional path between an object and the observer]
The opposing direction from which something emerges/originates/appears/etc.
notes: Stem Zero = area, general vicinity of a particular position/location relative to the observer, whether 2-dimensional or 3-dimensional according to the situational context
“right here”, at the center point of the observer’s 3-dimensional spatial frame of reference
above the observer
below the observer
in front of the observer
behind the observer
to the right of the observer
to the left of the observer
in front of and above the observer
in front of and below the observer
behind and above the observer
behind and below the observer
to the right and in front of the observer
to the right and behind the observer
to the right and above the observer
to the right and below the observer
to the left and in front of the observer
to the left and behind the observer
to the left and above the observer
to the left and below the observer
to the right, in front, and above the observer
to the right, in front, and below the observer
to the right, behind, and above the observer
to the right, behind, and below the observer
to the left, in front, and above the observer
to the left, in front, and below the observer
to the left, behind, and above the observer
to the left, behind, and below the observer
e.g., “among others in a crowded room”

refers: POSITION BETWEEN/AMONG [IN A LINEAR UNIDIMENSIONAL CONTEXT]
notes: e.g., “between two others in a queue”
e.g., “among a sky full of balloonists”

refers: POSITION/STATE INTERTWINED/INTERMINGLED/INTERMIXED IN 2-DIMENSIONAL PLANAR CONTEXT [INDIVIDUAL COMPONENTS SEPARABLE/EXTRACTABLE]
notes: e.g., “red marbles amidst a tabletop covered with different colored marbles”

refers: POSITION/STATE INTERTWINED/INTERMINGLED/INTERMIXED IN 3-DIMENSIONAL VOLUME [INDIVIDUAL COMPONENTS SEPARABLE/EXTRACTABLE]
notes: e.g., “red marbles within a jar full of different colored marbles”

refers: POSITION/STATE INTERTWINED/INTERMINGLED/INTERMIXED IN 2-DIMENSIONAL PLANAR CONTEXT [INDIVIDUAL COMPONENTS INSEPARABLE/PERMANENTLY COMBINED]
notes: e.g., “yellow paint spread onto a blue canvas to make a green area”

refers: POSITION/STATE INTERTWINED/INTERMINGLED/INTERMIXED IN 3-DIMENSIONAL VOLUME [INDIVIDUAL COMPONENTS INSEPARABLE/PERMANENTLY COMBINED]
notes: e.g., “sugar granules poured into a cup of coffee”

stems.BSC: (to be/manifest) a degree of linear proximity/distance in space and/or time between entities — [both the spatio-temporal expanse and the effect/consequences thereof]
stems.CTE: (to be/manifest) the effect/consequences of the spatio-temporal distance/proximity between entities
stems.CSV: (to be/manifest) a degree of linear proximity/distance in space and/or time between entities
stems.OBJ: (to be) an entity/party at a certain distance/proximity to another

stems: (to be/manifest a) degree of linear spatial proximity/distance/spatial interval between entities
(to be/manifest a) degree of temporal proximity/distance [i.e., elapsed time between entities]
